title: Plug Research Logo
content:
I've been playing with this logo all weekend. It's for a record label focused on underground experimental electronic music. Trying some different variations here. I colored #4 because that's the one I'm leaning towards at the moment. Strikes a nice balance compared to 2/3 & 5/6 I think.

Looking for some feedback. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [plug.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621031422/http:/typophile.com/files/plug.gif) | 36.62 KB |
author: subcons

comments.content: I can't see the difference between 1&5, but I like them.

<cite>I can’t see the difference between 1&5, but I like them.</cite>

1-3 are using a more narrow U that matches the L and G, while 4-6 are using a wider U which matches the P. I think I like the wider U. Seems more balanced to me. Also, 1 is using a different face for ‘research’ than 5.
Very nice. The wider U definitely. I think the whole mark could be heavier.
i like the logo as well. I might be repeating logosam, but I think a heavier stroke for "PLUG" to give it some more weight and provide a little more contrast to "research"

I don't like number 1. And 2,3,4,5, and 6 as well. They all look like something done by the guy who owns the corner hardware store. I don't get _'record label focused on underground experimental electronic music'_ from that effort. They seem flat and trite.

Try saying Plug without showing a plug... nothing more boring than a literal interpretation.

I agree with Hiroshige...looking at them, I felt they were all fine for an electrician or the like, but then realized it was for a record label.

Keep this on the options list, but I'd suggest some more brainstorming as well.

If you want to go with some sort of imagery, it might be a bit more fun to go with an outlet than a plug - see [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621031422/http:/www.flickr.com/search/?s=int&ss=1&ct=6&w=all&q=outlet+electric&m=tags) for inspirations.

Eeblet's right. For an underground record label it's got to be something out there. Her images would be a good starting place.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621031422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/plug_3799.jpg)
Ooooh, if you want to be really edgy: [(SOOOO not safe for work)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621031422/http:/www.goodvibes.com/Item--i-14BA04)

Ha. Love it eeblet.

I don't really see how depicting an outlet would be any more “edgy” than a plug per say. Just as “flat and trite” as jsgh would say. I listen to quite a lot of music and most of it is on indie labels. These labels, the ones with well designed identities, are usually not very edgy, but more subtle/sophisticated/modern for the most part.

I get the idea though. Back to the drawing board. May just drop the visual element all together and stick with typography.

Thanks again for the insight/suggestions.

I never said the outlet would be edgy - only "more fun". I think you can play with the imagery in this one, although of course a nice typographic treatment would be fine, too. For starters, just let your drawings run free - don't be too anal.

(OMG I AM SORRY)
